results.title: A Hill in Korea = Hell in Korea
results.creator_credit: Julian Amyes, Anthony Squire, British Lion Films and Wessex Film Productions
results.brief_description: Based on true events and the novel by Max Catto, “A Hill in Korea” is a portrayal of a small group of British soldiers in action during the Korean War. Their combined enemy is communism and the Chinese soldiers who have landed in North Korea to support the North Korean Army. Whilst performing a routine sweep of a small communist-held village, the British patrol unwittingly find themselves trapped and surrounded by an army of Chinese soldiers. It becomes a life and death battle as they attempt to escape, but inevitably they are forced to the top of a small hill where the last stand is made in a deserted Buddhist Temple. Starring George Baker, Stanley Baker, Harry Andrews and featuring - briefly - a very young Michael Caine making his film debut and Robert Shaw in a supporting role in only his second film. Cast also includes Michael Medwin, Ronald Lewis, Stephen Boyd, Victor Maddern, Harry Landis.

results.title: A Heritage to build on
results.creator_credit: Derek Williams, Humphrey Swingler and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: Made as part of the Cement and Concrete Association’s contribution to European Architectural Heritage Year 1975, shows the many types of Britain’s old and modern architecture. It contrasts the present time, when renewal and renovation of urban environment is a matter of concern, with the past. It shows that with thoughtful use of today’s materials such as concrete, old and modern buildings can be compatible with those of the past.

results.title: A Heart in winter = Un Coeur en hiver
results.creator_credit: Claude Sautet, Philippe Carcassonne, Jean-Louis Livi, FR3, Paravision International, D.A. Films, SEDIF, Orly Films, Cinea and Film Par Film
results.brief_description: Daniel Auteil and Emmanuelle Beart (the leading actors from Manon Des Sources) star in this triangular love story which explores the darker recesses of the heart and soul; where emotion is repressed. Two longtime friends in the classical music world find their friendship is threatened when a beautiful woman enters their lives. Ravel’s music forms a striking background to the drama as one woman embarks on a journey of surrender to passion.

results.title: A Haunted school
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This moving picture describes bizarre events at a school. A girl goes missing and two detectives set out to find her. Once in the school they turn into students and are horrified when they experience ghostly sightings of the victim. They suffer mortal wounds and turn on each other as they are scared out of their wits. Finally they themselves become possessed and are forever trapped at the school, never to escape.

results.title: A Hard Day's Night
results.brief_description: Capturing John Lennon, Paul McCartney, George Harrison and Ringo Starr in their electrifying element, A Hard Day’s Night is a wildly irreverent journey through this pastiche of a day in the life of The Beatles during 1964.

constellations_other.name: Music and fandom
constellations_other.description: Sometimes fans create their own amazing artworks.

results.description: Capturing John Lennon, Paul McCartney, George Harrison and Ringo Starr in their electrifying element, ‘A Hard Day’s Night’ is a wildly irreverent journey through this pastiche of a day in the life of The Beatles during 1964. The band have to use all their guile and wit to avoid the pursuing fans and press to reach their scheduled television performance, in spite of Paul’s troublemaking grandfather and Ringo’s arrest.
description_for_label: Capturing John Lennon, Paul McCartney, George Harrison and Ringo Starr in their electrifying element, ‘A Hard Day’s Night’ is a wildly irreverent journey through this pastiche of a day in the life of The Beatles during 1964. The band have to use all their guile and wit to avoid the pursuing fans and press to reach their scheduled television performance, in spite of Paul’s troublemaking grandfather and Ringo’s arrest.

results.title: A Hard day's night
results.creator_credit: Richard Lester, Walter Shenson and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Starring the Beatles, this comic fantasia with music uses a multitude of cinematic gags. An enormous commercial success, it led directly to all the kaleidescope swinging London spy thrillers and comedies of the late sixties. In this film the Beatles, harrased by their manager and Paul’s grandpa, embark from Liverpool by train for a London television show.

results.title: A Hard course
results.creator_credit: Arthur Smith, Stanley Williamson and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: The arguments for and against the system of intensive training for boys and girls at the Outward Bound Mountain School in Cumberland. The school aims at “character training through adventure and testing experience”.

results.title: A Harbour goes to France
results.brief_description: The official British Army and Admiralty film of “Operation Mulberry”, the unique prefabricated harbour which was floated across the English Channel in sections, and erected in a matter of hours on the coast of Normandy during the critical days following D-Day, World War II.

results.title: A Happy childhood
results.brief_description: An English language version of a Russian propaganda film promoting the virtues of Stalinist policies for the protection of children’s welfare. If much of this socialist child-rearing looks severe and Spartan, the film is punctuated throughout by genuine moments of charm and whimsy. In many respects this is an enchanting film; accordingly, the film is a fascinating study in propaganda cinema.

results.title: A Handful of soil
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Mollot and Sam Orleans and Associates
results.brief_description: Research in the development of antibiotics, particularly that of Dr Selman Waksman; also cooperation of scientists and pharmaceutical companies in the mass prodution of antibiotics. From penicillin to streptomycin and beyond.
